Reviews.Title: “Regin Hotel nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Saki C
Reviews.Content: For 95 Sin$ a shoebox type of room with a shower hose in toilet is a rip off. the TV had a bout 1 english program and the rest of the channels where snowy white. Maintenance rather poor. If Inew before I would have avoided to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room was OK”
Reviews.Author: hills168
Reviews.Content: Room is small but clean, it was OK to me at this price. The front desk offered me a free bottle of water on arrival but no more bottle after that even I paid same price as the first date.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not bad”
Reviews.Author: djpinks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights....... no real complaints other than a rather unpleasant smell. You get what you pay for: not much.

Reviews.Title: “Average price for average quality”
Reviews.Author: PeteJN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for the budget traveler and you should not expect anything above the average. The room was a bit dated with a few marks on the wall, but the bed was comfy and it had aircon, tv and a fridge which were all fine. The bathroom was functional and fine. Its located on the metro which is handy and its on Sims avenue which has an interesting local nightlife. All in all, its basic but (for Singapore) reasonably priced. If you are on a budget you may as well give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: pd-dp
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for simple and inexpensive accommodation in Singapore, the Hotel Regin is a good option. The standard rooms are clean but very small so they are probably only OK for a solo traveler. And unless you plan to spend a lot of time in your room, the small size isn't a big deal. The hotel is a couple of long blocks from the Kallang SMRT station. A fairly easy walk and once on the SMRT, you can get to just about anywhere in Singapore. I was told that the Geylang section of the city is the "red light" district, but the Hotel Regin is on the edge of Geylang and I didn't notice anything "red light" around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really quite good for the price, better than Hotel 81 Lucky”
Reviews.Author: imetmytruelove
Reviews.Content: I booked in here through Agoda as I didn't like when I stayed at Lucky (mouldy, musty smell and plastic mattress and sheets with holes in them). Expected much the same, but was very surprised. I was only staying for a 23 hour layover before returning to Australia and didn't want to hang at the budget terminal that long, so came into Regin Hotel. The taxi driver found it a bit hard to find - his GPS took us to 250 Sims Avenue instead of 56. Maybe if you tell the driver it is near the corner of Sims Way and Sims Avenue you might get here quicker. Once inside I was warmly welcome by a very friendly elderly Chinese gentleman, whose name escapes me. Very obliging. The only shock was when he asked for a $S50 deposit in cash, as I had not been aware of this. I looked in my wallet but after the taxi fare had only around $40 so he said $20 was fine, and this was returned to me in the morning immediately upon checkout, where once again I was greeted by the reception staff in a warm and friendly manner. The room itself was small and it is an older style hotel, but there was no bad smells in the room, and there was no mould in the bathroom. Shower didn't get really hot, but was passable. Like many Singapore rooms there is no curtain in the shower, so the whole bathroom gets wet - toilet, sink, bathroom floor etc, but not really a drama. Bed was very comfortable. Got two free small bottles of water on arrival and 2 small toothbrush and paste sets. Aircon worked very well. Tv has a wide variety of channels, even if few in English. Small mini fridge in wardrobe to keep the water cold. This is dearer than Hotel 81 Lucky, but if you want accommodation at the budget end of the scale this is certainly one I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Left after 40 minutes!”
Reviews.Author: Sazzykins
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel in November 2011 after spending two weeks in Borneo. I walked into the room the smell just hit me! The smell of smoke was discusting! So my immediate reaction was to go and ask for a no-smoking room. I got informed that you could smoke in all the rooms. As a non-smoker I found the smell too much. So I asked if they could do anything about the smell. The lady behind the desk said she would send the cleaner with some airfreshner. I then went back to my room were my husband was waiting. He had then established by this point that the windows would not open, the air con was broken and made an irritating noise and the tv had no channels that worked. There was also lots of different splash marks across the Walls, I'm just glad I don't know what they where! When the cleaner arrived she only had a bottle of some sort of cleaner. She proceeded to spray behind the wardrobe, desk and curtains. It turn out that she was spraying bleach everywhere! So then we were then left with the strong smell of bleach and cigarette smoke. It was horrible, so much it made me fell sick! This was the last straw for me and I sat on the bed and cried! My husband then decided that he was not happy seeing me like this and said we were leaving regardless if wether or not we could not get our money back. The management kindly gave us a full refund and we left to go and stay somewhere else. We ended up at the novotel Clarke quay, which I can highly recommend - it's worth the extra dollars! Please don't think I am being a snob as I have stay in budget hotels all the time but this is by far the one I have disliked the most. I chose this hotel purely on the judgement of fellow trip advisor members and I was completely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back!”
Reviews.Author: Kalamare
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed in two single rooms 24-29July 2011, and we had a great time. The staff were helpful and friendly beyond belief, the hotel itself is located in the Geyland area, but away from all the noise and bustle. Madam See helped us reserve online with no advance understanding our problem that we didn't have credit card, Sunny and the rest of the reception staff were so welcoming and friendly during our stay. Thanks very much everyone, for making our stay delightful. We will certainly be coming back for vacation soon, and look forward to seeing you again!

Reviews.Title: “Perspective is needed here”
Reviews.Author: inspectorjavert70
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a damned expensive city. For S$90, in any other part of S.E. Asia, you could get a 3-4 star hotel in most downtowns. When I walked into my room, I have to say I was a bit taken aback, but I wasn't in Singapore to sit in my room, so it sufficed. The Kalang MRT stop is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel, will take you anywhere you want to go, and fast. The staff at this place is hit-or-miss: Sonny ("look at the Sun, and remember my name is Sonny") is a gas and helps with anything you might need, another guy (didn't get his name) who was working the desk when I checked out, wouldn't even call me a taxi-he just told me to go stand on the curb with my bags during peak morning rush hour and stick my hand out, and hopefully someone would stop. Thanks much for that.... I am a single guy and walked the area at night, I wasn't harrased by anyone, and never felt in danger in the least - it's far enough away from the red-light district where it doesn't feel seedy at all, although there were plenty of Singaporean men coming in and out for most of the day and night paying the "in-transit" fee with their "companions". The room itself, while a shoebox, did the job fine - it has a little fridge, small LCD TV on the wall, and AC, but it looked as though someone took a golf club to the AC controls (see pic), so the temp couldn't be adjusted. Wifi, in room, worked well. While I didn't hear any shenanigans going on by the temporary guests, it was annoying to have about a dozen chinese tourists check in at about midnight, and begin screaming to each other from the various floors they were assigned to. This went on for about an hour before I told them all to shut the hell up (I doubt they understood me, but they could tell I didn't appreciate their form of communication). If this were in most other cities, I would in no way recommend it, but because Singapore is so expensive, Regin Hotel is a viable option for a short term stay (no more than 3-4 nights).

Reviews.Title: “value for monry to stay in singspore”
Reviews.Author: indontim
Reviews.Content: Its worthy to stay in this hotel. Conveniently located near train station and food courts. Many land bus services available. The room is good and comfortable. Quite surrounding. Friendly staff service really warming me at my evening checkin. it is safe at night to walk around in the area. will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and probably a bit expensive versus other options”
Reviews.Author: Benchmarker
Reviews.Content: I arrived from Indonesia late in Singapore and just needed to have a shower and a few hours sleep before my next flight, my usual hotels where full so through the TripAdvisor comments I had to make a choice for a reasonably priced property. The location is not to far from the airport, lots of local restaurants in the area, but the hotel need really to be freshening up. Very nice staff, good airco, reasonably choice of TV channels, they have internet but I did not try it, and all this does not compensate my feeling that maybe it was not as clean as it looked like, again due to the lack of fresh paint and finishing touches.... I probably choose another location next time if the other hotels are available.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: zwabber
Reviews.Content: We read the tripadvisor reviews and were persuaded by several positive reviews to stay for a night, but now we wonder who wrote those unrealistic positive accounts. The reality: extremely small and basic rooms. Our advice: avoid this hotel, pay a little more for a better and safer hotel. We complained in writing to the hotel that someone entered our room and stole a few things, which we discovered only the next day when we unpacked our suitcases. Luckily we had our passports, money, credit cards, netbook etc. with us for the two hours we left our room in the afternoon. The hotel claimed that their security video did not indicate anybody entering the room. Pictures on website of rooms are not a realistic representation.

Reviews.Title: “worth it!”
Reviews.Author: lj3dux
Reviews.Content: We got the family room since I'm 7 months pregnant and my 2 boys (9 & 11) can never sleep in one position. It was very spacious! The room has its own electric hot pot, a small fridge inside the cabinet, instant coffee is replenished everyday plus fresh towels everyday too. We were also able to ask for bottled water everyday. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful too! The bus stop is just a block away and the MRT station (Kallang station) is only about a 5-minute walk. Also, the hawkers are just a street away. My only complain would be the hard pillows but that's only because I'm pregnant! And i needed a soft one for my belly. If not it would really be not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Singapor”
Reviews.Author: Warlocke
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is quite good. We initially got a Family Room which can comfortably accommodate 3 adults and 1 kid (1 queen bed and 1 single bed). They provided the basics - a ref, towels, water heater, bath soap, coffee and mugs as well as free wi-fi in the room all for a good price. Pros: 1. Near enough Kallang MRT (15 mins for us) and bus stops if you prefer buses instead 2. Around 30 mins to the airport, for 15SGD 3. It may be in the Geylang area, but it is only at the periphery - the place where the eateries are located. We even ate there at night - lots of choices! 4. It is Sims Way st, parallel to Geylang Road which is quiet at night Cons: 1. If you are really on a tight budget, there are a couple of other cheaper choices a block away from here but you'll be right smack into the Geylang night life. This one has little night life activity 2. No breakfast included Book with them at http://www.reginhotel.com/ Note that the rooms are indeed smaller than what it looks like in the pictures

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay!”
Reviews.Author: haxxej
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very close to Kallang Mrt - about 10mins by walk, which makes it very convenient as in few minutes you can reach anywhere in Singapore by using the MRT. The area is safe even though it is close by to the red light district. The hotel is also used by short time adventures ;) but it's not a dirty or noisy hotel. The rooms are on the small side, as you can expect in Singapore, unless you are willing to shell out a hefty sum of money for a 5* hotel. Altough small, the room is equipped with a comfy queen size bed, wardrobe, fridge and small lcd tv. I had a problem with my aircon however room was changed without problems and the a/c was working this time. Wifi is available free of charge in the rooms, although on my 2nd room this signal wasn't that great. The staff are nice and helpful - I think this is a family run hotel but not sure about it. It just felt that way. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay where you would spend most of the time out of your room exploring Singapore as compared to most hotels it is very good priced. If I'm back in Singapore, most probably I would consider staying here again, unless of course I win the lottery and will afford to stay at the Marina Bay Sands :)

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm...”
Reviews.Author: bobOkinawa
Reviews.Content: ++The man at the counter always funny and helpful Free internet and movie channels available room clean and safe close to metro station Price is very good for singapore, but should not pay more fo their room - - Lot of prositutes coming every night which makes the place quite noisy Rooms look MUCH MORE BETTER on the pictures... photographer is so smart... Bathroom very small, single room without window Not a bad hotel.. but better to for hort stay only.. 3,4 days maxi

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: anupam_bhattacharjee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Location is good. you will get lot's of food options around the area. We payed singpaore dollar 95 for each room. but room was not so big. As per budget i feel it's a good place for stay .You will find lot's of pros in this area even they were coming to hotel but they were not disturbing any one.Seems it's allowed in that area as we got to know that it's in red light district. The hotel is in safe place you can walk around at night without any problem. The reception is good. but you will not get any room service. you need to carry your own bags to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: RealFuture
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for four nights. Book a superior room, it's not large but clean with good facilities. TV, fridge, free wireless internet. The bed was comfortable. The hotel is close the MRT station, about 5 minutes walking to get there. Very nice price for a Singapore hotel. Recommend it to travellers.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT BUDGET HOTEL EVER IN SINGAPORE !”
Reviews.Author: Legna_Nivlag
Reviews.Content: Regin hotel is strongly recommended by me and my husband ! Although the room is a bit smaller than the picture we see online, but is very comfortable and i love everything about this hotel ! We have a sweet and unforgettable memories in this hotel, and this location is quite good and safe ( even is located near to geylang area but there is no any inconvenience to us) , and the staff are friendly, we love regin hotel and planning to stay there again!! :D

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: lozzzzie
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as a cheap option for a stay of four nights in Singapore. I would definitely recommend it! The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was very clean (with bed sheets and towels changed daily) and the hotel is a fast 5 minutes walk from Kallang MRT. I stayed in a superior double room which was $85 for a mid-week stay. It was fairly big, with all the facilities described below by other travellers. Yes, the whole bathroom gets wet when you take a shower but it's not really a big deal. The area around the hotel is pretty safe - I was travelling on my own and did not feel unsafe once despite some late returns to the hotel. There's a few good places to eat very close by as well as shops. What really made this a good place to stay for me was 1. the price 2. the friendliness of the staff 3. the location and 4. the cleanliness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Worth to go there”
Reviews.Author: Nicoleri
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is good, like all Hotels it's in Singapore it's quite expensive. You pay for a standard room during the week 80 SGD and during the weekend 85 SGD. We stayed in a standard room and everything was available, there is a TV with HBO, a watercooker, a fridge and there is even some shampoo for free, plus you get everyday two bottles of water for free. The staff is really helpful and friendly. We definitely would recommend to stay in a deluxe room, it's just 5 SGD more, but you really get more space. The standard room is kind of small and if there are two people in the room you really have to fight for space :-). The location is quite good as well, you just have to walk about 8 min. and your at the MRT station Kallang, five minutes with the MRT and you are in the centre of the city. There are lots of hawkers stalls and other stores around. There is free wi-fi available.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not sure if I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Timao
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Regin sharing a room with my wife and a female friend. The hotel is located Geylang area, but I didnt see one single "lady of the night". It is safe and alright to walk from/to hotel - Kallang Station (MRT) any time of the day. It's cheap but comes with a price. We were located on the 5th flloor. Lift only goes up to 4th and after that is up to you to carry your luggage upstairs. Room is quite small and looks much better on their website. Our bed linen wasn't changed and our bathroom got wet every time we used the shower. If I had to go back, I reckon I'd spend a bit more and try something better. Ah, there's a wi-fi internet but even one of its staff recomended us not to buy, because was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Brandy39
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are spotless. Yes, the rooms are small, and my single room did not have a window, but it had an en suite bathroom, tv, mini fridge, and (unusual for this area) a wardrobe :) Tea and coffee making facilities were provided as was bottled water. Stocks were replenished daily as were fresh towels and bed linen The cost is S$55 weeknights and S$65 at weekends including all taxes and charges. Double rooms are about S$20 more. There is no dining on site but some of the best and cheapest food in Singapore is available just a few steps away. This is a very safe area as this is where Singaporeans dine out and most places are open 24hours, which is very handy if you are arriving at all hours of the night. I'm an older traveller and recommend this hotel to all age groups. Handy hint: pronounce "Regin" with a soft "g" or the taxi driver might confuse this hotel with the very upmarket "Regent".

Reviews.Title: “OK, but room rather small”
Reviews.Author: StChristopherUK
Reviews.Content: The 2 previous reviews have summed up this hotel well. I chose it for its proximity to the MRT, Kallang, which I would put nearer to 12 -15 mins walk away after crossing 2 busy roads. This station is on the line from/to the airport (8 stops). If you dont have much luggage use the MRT but a taxi wouldnt cost too much if you have a lot. My double room was certainly small and 2 large suitcases would have trouble fitting in. Not much room to hang clothes either and just small drawers. Other than that it was ok. Also had a small fridge The bathroom/toilet was clean and modern but it all gets wet when you have a shower. (Not untypical for a hotel of this grade/price). There are many 'ladies of the night' in the area after sunset. However you are most unlikely to come across any between the MRT and the hotel which is well lit and busy with traffic. Most of the action is in the opposite direction. The reception was friendly and helpful. 2 small bottles of water provided daily. I am sure more would be provided free if asked for nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good and comfortable sleep”
Reviews.Author: mamanth
Reviews.Content: Regin hotel is located very near the kallang station, 5-10 minutes walk only. It may be located in the Geylang area but not right into the heart of the "red light district". it is nicely situated near the intersection of sim's ave and sim's way. Among the budget hotels, it is the one which is least expensive and I would say that it is a good value for the money. And booking is not so hard, just email the hotel directly and they would do the rest and no credit card is needed, full payment is upon arrival. Although the room is smaller than the picture in the website. But It is relatively clean. They change your towels and linens daily, and the sheets are spotlessly clean and white. you get 2 bottles of drinking water and instant coffee daily. I guess, the next time we go back to singapore, we would stay again at regin hotel. We had a good night sleep after a whole day of walking around and enjoying singapore. Only warning is that when coming from the airport, tell the taxi driver that you are going to sims ave then tell them Regin hotel. We were initially brought to REGENT hotel hehehehe but the taxi driver was very apologetic and gave us a discount so it was okay because we had an initial tour of the city as well. this trip was my third time at singapore and i guess i would be coming back again.

HotelInfo.Name: Regin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 56 Sims Avenue, Singapore 387416, Singapore
